website_summaries.verdict: A great option for handling small egg clutches or a few larger duck or goose eggs, this model from Currens is inexpensive, sports a precise temperature reading, and easy to clean after your chicks hatch.
cons: A 7-egg capacity is a little on the small side

customer_reviews.title: Works Exactly as Described
customer_reviews.text: This was our first time hatching eggs so I was a bit nervous about messing something up, but this incubator took the guess work out of it. We hatched out 12 chicks all happy and healthy. The only thing I would change about this incubator is the instructions, they need to be clearer, but I managed to find an awesome how go video that helped immensely.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence O.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Incubator
customer_reviews.text: Hatching my quail eggs well. For a first Timer, I’m impressed how well it turned out. Just set it and forget it. Just added about 100 ml of warm water for humidity every other day and in about 16-18 days my quail eggs hatched.
customer_reviews.author: Irma Smith

customer_reviews.title: Overheats
customer_reviews.text: I turned this on for an hour and got concerned about the kind of heat it was outputting. I had it inside the brooder and was seriously concerned about the bedding catching fire so I gave up on this and used my more expensive Brinsea incubator. I also can't imagine it being comfy for chicks hatching in such direct heat. I guess you really do get what you pay for and this feels as cheap as it is.
customer_reviews.author: npk

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I will never know if any of the eggs could have been viable. After three days I went out there this morning and the temperature had dropped by 10 degrees for no reason. The machine just wasted seven eggs. If you really want to raise chickens spend more money and buy a better incubator.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Good starter
customer_reviews.text: Love the size. Fits on the counter. Does not really turn the eggs. A bit difficult to add the water and make sure all things are lined up properly. Good starter, but pricey in my opinion. Hopefully it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Saxon Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t work at all, my 7 year old saved up all his money to buy this to hatch some eggs, none of them hatched, made it to maybe day 8-9 and then they stopped growing, happened twice now. Water runs out so fast. Just not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste the time and money.
customer_reviews.text: Wont hold temp, wont hold humidity. Some eggs are hot, some aren't. And it's too small for 7 eggs honestly.
customer_reviews.author: barry

customer_reviews.title: Four stars
customer_reviews.text: Needs a way to control humidity better. It is either too low or too high.
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre Duke

customer_reviews.title: Useful incubator
customer_reviews.text: This product hatched chicken, guinea, & duck eggs very well. Have removed the Turner on my second unit & am trying to hatch some goose eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Ford

customer_reviews.title: It works great , but expensive but it’s good
customer_reviews.text: i like everything about it , its easy to use they say instructions are hard but its not really that hard, recently i had no surviving fertile eggs due to shipping but it’s okay i ended up putting it away for a while but one of my ducks laid eggs and most of her babies hatched and she left 3 2 were duds and we have one that is going strong
customer_reviews.author: Kaia

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working, eggs died and no response
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about 10 days, then stopped working incubated eggs all died, then it would work for about a week and then stopped working and eggs all died again. I wanted to return and only address that came up was in china and tried contacting seller but no answer.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: incubator
customer_reviews.text: love this thing, haven't used completly but plan on this spring tue test run went well
customer_reviews.author: sarah guidry

customer_reviews.title: Goldilocks nightmare: too cold, too hot, but never just right
customer_reviews.text: 38.0C is equal to 100F. But with this incubator 36.5 can be anywhere from 98F to 106F. Poor embryos. 2 hatchings failed. Hours of sleep lost trying to recalibrate temperatures: lost count. Days waking up to see temperatures of 106-110F:5 Number of chicks hatched: 0/14 Number of stars rated for this product: 0/5
customer_reviews.author: I Dream of Jeanie

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Not auto turning. Not large enough for normal chicken eggs. Rarely hatches chicks.
customer_reviews.author: candy

customer_reviews.title: Cannot return to China manufacturers!!
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold temperature at required degrees to hatch eggs. Cannot return to China manufacturers as it is forbidden at this time!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janis Frazier

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTED MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: The temperature was normal a few days ago, but it was 23 degrees afterwards. After waiting for 23 days, there was no sign of hatching after being illuminated by a lamp.And the place where the machine adds water has changed color
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: This is not an incubator I would ever buy again, does not hold moisture because you have to take the lid off to manually turn the eggs, every single time.
customer_reviews.author: Marti Overmyer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I should post negative review, because I personally don’t read positive reviews! This little thing actually works pretty good 👍
customer_reviews.author: Ales Gregor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works much better than anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works much better than anticipated. Would recommend and plan to purchase another one for other side of house.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad P.

customer_reviews.title: Will not heat eggs
customer_reviews.text: The whole thing is a bust. It can’t maintain temperature, and can’t even get up to 80 degrees
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: This thing broke and i cant get my money back do not buy
customer_reviews.text: The device did not stay at temperature and the eggs died on day 21 because it stopped working and we had to turn it on again and it wouldn’t set the temp properly
customer_reviews.author: April smart

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The eggs never developed. Tried a second batch and the heater melted the bottom and almost started a fire
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Broken piece
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Does not fit even 3 eggs. Didn’t come with the trey and temperature does not work. You will loose your eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Mike foote

customer_reviews.title: successful
customer_reviews.text: a pretty good incubator. I've never had such a good breeding result as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bowen

product_meta.title: Mini Egg Incubator Fully Digital Automatic Poultry Hatcher Machine with Temperature Control, Clear General Purpose Incubators for Chickens Ducks Goose Birds(7 Eggs)
product_meta.description:
7 eggs incubator is an apparatus that is used to regulate environmental conditions such as temperature, humidity for successful hatching of the fertile eggs placed in an enclosure.

Specification: 
Type: Egg Incubator
Material: ABS
Temperature: 38℃±1℃
Voltage: AC 110V / AC 220V
Frequency: 50Hz / 60Hz
Capacity: 7-10 quail eggs, 5-6 Normal size chicken eggs.1-2 duck and goose eggs
Size: 17.5cm x 17.5cm x 16cm/6.89" x 6.89" x 6.30" (Approx.)

Why Should You Choose Our Incubator? 
Uniform Heat and Humidity
Increase the hatching rate significantly and the transparent design is convenient for you to observe the hatching of the eggs. 
Lightweight and Convenient
This means that the egg incubator can be set up in the office or at home without taking up too much space. 
Easy to Use
Just simply insert the egg tray and put fresh fertilized eggs, connect the egg incubator, set the temperature, add water and close the lid.
Best Gift for Kids
This incubator is the perfect gift for children to learn more about the whole hatching process, cultivating children's curiosity. 

Tips:
The incubation period for chicken eggs is 21 days, duck eggs is 28 days and birds egg is about 18 days.
Be sure to read the instructions carefully before using. Make sure we know enough about the incubator and some common problems that we might meet during incubation process.
It is best to use eggs that have been fertilized in the last 7 days, which will greatly increase the hatching rate.

The machine DOES NOT have the function of automatic turning egg. 

1.Please turn off power every time before opening lid of machine
2. Please add water every one to two days, be careful not drip the water onto the exposed electrics
3. The eggs must be fresh, fertilized eggs, not washed
4. Please gently turn the eggs manually no less than eight times per day in the first 18 days

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
